head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Vatican City: Pope Closes Limbo

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Vatican City: Pope Closes Limbo

abstract.p: Netherworld of limbo, long speculated in Roman Catholic teaching as destination of babies who die unbaptized, has been replaced with 'prayerful hope' that they reach heaven; Pope Benedict signs theological report that effectively demotes limbo (S)

block.p: The netherworld of limbo, long speculated in Roman Catholic teaching as the destination of babies who die unbaptized, has been replaced with the ''prayerful hope'' that they reach heaven. Pope Benedict XVI signed a theological report, years in the making, that effectively demoted limbo, a place neither in heaven nor in hell, where unbaptized babies would not be in communion with God but would nonetheless enjoy eternal happiness. Many in the church felt the idea, never formally a part of church doctrine, was outdated and caused undue worry for parents.
